Tonight due to unforeseen circumstances TAKING SIDES have had to pull out of their Melbourne leg of their Australian tout with THE DEAD WALK!, and as a result of this, IN NAME AND BLOOD will be playing in their place.

so there you go.

i spent last night practicing scales to billy joel songs.

and i made paula listen to one of my JUD JUD 7's

reads this review for an explanation of JUD JUD for those of you who dont know.


Jud Jud

xthedemosx

I don't know any other way to put it, Jud Jud are an a cappella metal band. Two guys make all of the palm mute gallops, whammy bar dive bombs and high hat count offs. They even make back masking sounds. Strangely, instead of sounding like a Beavis and Butthead joke taken too far, they pull it off with enough humor to make it funny, enough skill to make it serious. The printing of the lyrics was a nice touch ("...jud jud jah gah goy gah goy..."). Another nice touch would be the show fliers showing Jud Jud headlining for such bands as Youth of Today, Bold, Minor Threat, and Dag Nasty.

List ten songs that you are currently digging... it doesn't matter what genre they are from, whether they have words, or even if they're no good but they must be songs you're really enjoying right now. Post these instructions, the artists, and the ten songs in your blog. Then tag five other people to see what they're listening to.

im with cam .. fuck songs.... heres the albums..

1 . Nile - Annihilation of the wicked

8 . Huey Lewis and the news - Forte!

10. in name and blood - bring me the horizon demos ( at least im honest )


 i tag fucking everyone...
especially dase.

sorry everyone but anberlin were awsome...
even though the singer looked like rod stewart...

has anyone else noticed how ugly the singer from anberlin is... fuck..how can that voice come out of that head....and he looks like hes about 40


on second thoughts..

how good are waffles..

i went and saw the blood brothers play tonight.
the problem was that they were exactly what i expected them to be like,both musically and theatrically....

completely predicable..

oh and there was also the fact that they looked like a bunch of anorexic,epileptic muppets..


i swear there were more girls jeans on boys than were on girls there...


and then i came home.


the end.
which one should we use?

we went to frankston today.. this is what happened. and then and then the abanbonment are my new fav band. and then these photos are much better than the show was. paula is cool. stay tuned for INAB promo photos down by the sea side... no really. i hate the beach.
this is all i have to say.

just got back from the atreyu / unearth / norma jean tour and i have to say that those bands are made up of some the the nicest,most supportive dudes that ive ever had the pleasure of meeting, who watched us play and stole our merch at every oppertunity..

hightlights included...

being invited up mid set to play a part of a atreyu song on the bass....to which i politly declined.

ken from unearth wanting to beat up bert from the used when they turned up at the show and took over the band room drinking all the beer and water and gernerally just behaving like rockstar arssholes.

bargain bin porn dvds... bad idear kids..

norma jean just being brutal every night..

leaving sydney and coming home to my girl..
paula and i went to the zoo today.... there seemed to be less animals than there were last time i was there.. maybe they died of boredom cause the animals i saw looked bored shitless..

watch out ..


atreyu/unearth/norma jean/in name and blood
this weekend...


were on 15 mins after doors on both days so if you want to catch us make sure your there nice and early.


out.

this is me with my friend dave at the ted leo show.. Dave was in rushmore with me back in the day ( if anybody remembers ) and hes my mate.. ( although in this photo he kinda looks like hes been up for days doing crazy drugs ) We dont hang out too much these days so i invited him over for dinner. oh and ted leo rocked pretty hard.....and although he could have done with a few chisel songs in the set, the cover of "six months in a leaky boat " was pretty darn tops..

deicide.. cannibal corpse.. carcass.. its a different sort of mid 90"s get into it kids. oh and paula got her first x-box game yesterday.. im very proud of her... welcome to the family.. and just so nobody forgets.. HOW GOOD ARE THESE FILMS!!!!!!
funny stuff right here....

well well well what a weekend...... i never write shit like this but oh well... im bored..


thursday night INAB at next........... it turned out far better than i though it would,lots of kids and the set went well.. in fact it was the longest set we have ever played.. 50 mins apparently.. it was nice to road test some new songs.. then piled into the tarago and drove straight to boobalaide and a good dumbing down ( errgggggggg MOSH )
Highlights of the drive included craig halluciating from lack of sleep ( watch out for the rusted car ) and me being a really funny cunt..
The a-town shows was the best of the 4... sold out show ( must have been an act of god or something ) and had lots of fun on stage... fingers started to bleed at this show..
drove back to melbourne on sat........ the show at the arty was fun as they always are.... bled some more....
By the time sunday came around we were pretty fucked so i apologize if we were less energetic than usual... i think we were a little put off by the massive stage and barrier at the show.... had fun though.. lots of kids and lots of friends there.. bled lots.. met leith at the first aid tent after the set and canceled band practice cause we couldn't hold our picks anymore...
many thanks to cassie-jane for all the hard work she put into the weekend and many thanks to a secret death for being rad and not wearing makeup.

and i missed the girl all weekend..

c.
watch out for new In Name and Blood  "mosh - just say NO "  shirts coming soon..

i got tattooed today.. all i can say is ouch.... the rest of the shading is to come as well as the colour.. whack chord. missing link instore tigers are hot dillinger show

iron lung at the pink palace last night = awsome.

terror firma = not so awsome but that could have been my crappy playing..

some random punk dude knocking over my amp and busting it  = completely un-awsome.

sitting waiting to be picked up so i can fly to crafter fest so i can rock out with the popped collared, sideways capped "hardcore" population of adelaide.... isnt life grand.


the end.

p.s everyone read dases new zine = awsome.

Comment of the night (sunday night as i lay dying/shadowsfall)goes to the two awsome boofhead metal dudes who were standing behind me during parkway drives set... 

and i quote.

metalhead #1
"if that cunt with shirt off and tattoos comes near me with those kicks im going to rip his fucking head off"

metal head #2
"yeah and not even that shit jesus tattoo is going to save, in fact ill kill him as well"


long live metal.


have you ever noticed that most true old school metal heads just look down their noses at hardcore bands that play pretend metal.......
Its casue they know that most metal kids get into it for life and stay dedicated to metal.... even if they start listening to other things as well......where as most hardcore kids last as long as it takes to find another bandwagon to jump onto...

Wanna know why metal will ALWAYS be cooler than hardcore?
its because metal kids never think their cool and they dont want it anyway...
where as hardcore oozes coolness.. its hip and thats what makes it really UNcool.

heres to never getting a haircut...


EDIT : I INVENTED METAL AS WELL APPARENTLY
